text: Your Tuesday Evening BriefingHere’s what you need to know at the end of the day.
Listen to  ‘The Daily’A dinner and a deal.
The Book Review PodcastA.O. Scott talks about Edward P. Jones.
When the former president speaks on Tuesday, it will be the first Democratic convention since the 1980s where he will be little more than a bystander.
Democrats have assembled a mash-up of the “next generation of party leaders.” But are they missing an opportunity to showcase the next Barack Obama?
Democrats are scrambling to recreate the excitement of the D.N.C. with virtual events, invite-only briefings and “Joe 2020” champagne flutes.
Ms. Urquiza, who gave a scathing speech on the first night of the Democratic convention, spoke to The Times about her father’s support of President Trump.
Compared to 2016, television audiences dipped for the first night of the Democrats’ virtual convention.
President Trump and President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia at the Group of 20 summit in Japan last year. Erin Schaff/The New York Times
Here are eight takeaways from the Senate Intelligence Committee’s report.
A Quest Diagnostics facility in Teterboro, N.J. In July, Quest became the first commercial lab to receive emergency authorization for pooled testing. Ryan Christopher Jones for The New York Times
Manhattan Vacancy Rate Climbs, and Rents Drop 10%There were more than 67,300 units available in July across the city as it tries to rebound from the coronavirus outbreak.
The University of North Carolina moved classes online, but sports will continue, for now.

Postal Service Suspends Changes After Outcry Over Delivery SlowdownPolicy changes by the postmaster general prompted allegations that the Trump administration was trying to disenfranchise voters before the election.
What Is QAnon, the Viral Pro-Trump Conspiracy Theory?Explaining the “big tent conspiracy theory” that falsely claims that President Trump is facing down a shadowy cabal of Democratic pedophiles.
We’re tracking results from primary elections in Florida, Wyoming and Alaska.
Investors cast the drumbeat of bad news aside to focus on any signs that the worst of the pandemic might be over, pushing the market to a new record.
Kim McCoy, pictured in Morningside Park with her sister’s dog, Indy, wants to run ultramarathons again. Brittainy Newman for The New York Times
Thomas L. FriedmanWill 2020’s Election Be the End of Our Democracy?A free and fair vote and the prospect of a peaceful transfer of power are both in question.
Frank BruniMichelle Obama Showed Us Why These Democrats Are Our Last Best HopeYou can “hate politics,” but you can’t sit out this election.
‘The Former First Lady Crushed It.’ Our Writers Break Down Night 1.

Suffrage at 100: A Visual HistoryHow did American women win the right to vote? These images help bring their decades-long movement into focus.
Chaat Is More Than the Sum of Its Many FlavorsHard to define but easy to crave, these Indian snacks have become a fascination for the Nashville chef Maneet Chauhan.
You Can’t Find a Laptop. Now What?Americans went on a home electronics-buying craze spurred by the pandemic, and it has lasted for far longer than anyone predicted.

Senate Report Examines Possible Compromises in Trump Trips to RussiaPresident Trump may have had a relationship with a former Miss Moscow, the report said, but investigators “did not establish” that Russia had compromising information.
